oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cotton Makers Jubilee Parade on Beale Street, with children pulling float
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Taylor, Reverend L.O.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Leisure
African American women; African Americans; Parades
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Parade with float bearing an African American woman in a formal dress, being pulled by two young African American boys, down a public street, Hamilton High School Banner behind.

The Cotton Makers Jubilee, which officially began in 1937, was the African American version of Memphis's Cotton Carnival. This parade is taking place on Beale Street. There are no white onlookers visible.
